newsArray.title: Rohit Sharma declines fan‚Äôs vada pav offer during Mumbai training, Internet reacts
newsArray.description: Indian batting star Rohit Sharma is once again making headlines off the field, this time for firmly sticking to his renewed fitness regime. Ahead of the upcoming India vs New Zealand ODI series, the former India captain was seen politely declining an offer of Mumbai‚Äôs iconic street food, vada pav, from a fan during a training session in Mumbai.Viral Moment from Training SessionIn a video that has gone viral on social media, Rohit can be seen preparing for a training session when fans gathered nearby called out to him. One fan, speaking in Marathi, offered him a vada pav, long known as Rohit‚Äôs favourite snack.‚ÄúRohit bhaiya, vadapav pahije ka?‚Äù the fan asked.Rohit responded with a smile, waved his hand and clearly signalled a no, choosing discipline over indulgence. The moment quickly caught attention online, with fans praising his commitment to fitness.After the practice session ended, when Rohit Sharma came out, the fans jokingly said, "Rohit bhaiya, vadapav pahije ka" and Rohit just waved his hand and replied, "No" üòÇ‚ù§Ô∏èbRO always enjoy with his fans‚ù§Ô∏è pic.twitter.com/euco1nvMqs‚Äî Rushiii45 (@rushiii_12) January 6, 2026Fitness First Ahead of International ReturnEver since retiring from Test cricket last year and shifting his full focus to ODIs, Rohit has been particularly careful about his diet and physical conditioning. After an impressive outing for Mumbai in the Vijay Hazare Trophy, he is set to rejoin the Indian squad for the three-match ODI series against New Zealand.This is not the first time Rohit has turned down vada pav. A similar moment had occurred earlier during the Vijay Hazare Trophy, underlining a consistent approach to his fitness goals.A Revamped Rohit SharmaFormer India cricketer Abhishek Nayar had earlier revealed that Rohit significantly changed his eating habits and trained intensely ahead of the Australia tour last year. The results showed on the field, as Rohit finished 2025 as India‚Äôs second-highest run-getter after Virat Kohli, scoring 650 runs with two centuries and four fifties.With the first ODI against New Zealand scheduled for January 11, Rohit‚Äôs viral moment reflects a clear message: focus, fitness and form remain his top priorities.
creator: bibhu prasad ray

newsArray.title: Stuart Broad Claims Yuvraj Singh's Six Sixes Saved Five Years Of His Career - 'A Slap On The Face'
newsArray.description: Stuart Broad reflected on Yuvraj Singh's six sixes in the 2007 T20 World Cup and claimed that it saved five years of his career. The England cricket legend called the incident a 'slap on his face.' Broad also hailed Ben Stokes' comeback after the 2016 T20 World Cup.
creator: aayush kataria

newsArray.title: Shaheen Shah Afridi quashes reports of long-term injury scare ahead of World Cup
newsArray.description: Mumbai, Jan 6, 2026 Pakistan spearhead Shaheen Shah Afridi quashed hopes of him being doubtful for the Twenty20 World Cup, saying his rehab is well on course and will be completed by next week, a news report has claimed. The 25-year-old damaged his left knee during the Big Bash League in Australia during his not [...]The post Shaheen Shah Afridi quashes reports of long-term injury scare ahead of World Cup appeared first on Yes Punjab News.

newsArray.title: 'Silly to underestimate them': NZ skipper backs Rohit and Kohli for 2027 ODI WC
newsArray.description: New Zealand skipper Michael Bracewell cautioned against underestimating seasoned Indian batters Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma ahead of the ODI series. He believes both veterans still possess the form to feature in next year's ODI World Cup. Bracewell also acknowledged the challenge of missing key players but expressed confidence in his team's collective effort to perform well in India.
creator: toi sports desk
